result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua David Scherer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Joshua David Scherer is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Joshua David Scherer was found guilty of OWI (2nd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant shall contact the Iron County Sheriff's Department at (715) 561-2440 within 10 business days of sentencing to make arrangements to provide a DNA sample.  Defendant shall also pay the surcharge for same.
Def may serve jail in another county if no additional expense to Iron County.
Defendant shall have installed and maintain an IID in any vehicle titled in his name.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joshua David Scherer

records.descr: Order for intox driver assessment and safety plan

records.addlTxt: 11:04 AM Court calls case.  Cites appearances.  Defendant Joshua David Scherer appeared by video.  Prosecuting attorney Matthew J Tingstad in court for the State of Wisconsin.   Court provides background.  DA Count 1, dismiss, Count 3, dismiss.  Count 2-NC plea, State requests minimums across the board.  DA asks for 30 days for def to report to jail.  Def intends to possibly do jail in St. Croix County.  Def agrees and understands.  5 days jail, $1429 incl., 12 mo. revoc, AODA, IID to be installed.  Court goes through rights def is waiving.  Def waives right to atty.  Court questions further.  Def understands proceeding and rights waiving.  Court goes through Constitutional rights.  No promises or threats to plead today.  Court questions further.  DA moves to dismiss Ct. 1 and 3, granted.  Def pleads G to Ct. 2.  Court finds sufficient FB for guilty finding.  Court does so.  JOC to be entered.  Proceed to sentencing.  DA addresses Court before sentencing.  Explains why requesting minimums.  Def thanks court for help getting through process.  Court accepts recomm.  $1429, 5 days jail 60 DTR.  Can be served in another county.  DL revoc 12 mos.  IID 12 mos, AODA..  60 DTP.  Def to provide DNA sample if not already done, when reports to jail.  Adj.  11:16 a.m.  klr
Plea hearing on October 12, 2022 at 11:00 am.

10:35 a.m.  Court calls case, cites appearances.  Def appears via Zoom.  Matthew J. Tingstad appears in person for the State of WI.  Short recess.  10:41 a.m.  BOR:  DA states agreement.  Court addresses def re guidelines.  Court inquires if def still wants to have plea hearing today.  Def states agreement was no jail time.  Per Court, jail is mandatory.  DA addresses Court.  Court states def can serve in another county if arrangements made.  Court again asks def if still wants to proceed.  Def adjourns PLEA to allow def time to research options.  PLEAH scheduled for 10/12 at 11:00 a.m.  Adj.  klr

11:18 a.m.  Court calls case, cites appearances.  Def appears via Zoom.  Matthew J. Tingstad appears for the State of WI.  Def wants to waive atty for now so he can discuss case with DA.  Understands value of attorney.  Def understands proceeding.  Court accepts waiver.  7/27 at 8:30 for PTC via phone.  Adj.  11:21 a.m.  klr
Pre-trial conference on July 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.

10:58 a.m.  Court calls case, cites appearances.  Def appears via Zoom.  Matthew J. Tingstad appears for the State of WI.  Court provides background.  Def acknowledges receipt of complaint.  Court reads charges and penalties.  Def understands.  Right to atty is explained to def.  Def intends to get atty.  Case to be set for AIA to allow def to return with counsel.  DA requests $750 signature bond with no alcohol prohibition.  Court sets $500 cash bond with no alcohol prohibition.  Bond to be mailed to 216 5th Street, Moose Lake, MN.  AIA set for 8/1 at 9:00 a.m.  Court quashes warrant.  Def to return bond in a week.  Adj.  11:05 a.m.  klr
Return on warrant on July 15, 2022 at 10:30 am.

09:14 AM Defendant Joshua David Scherer not in court.  Matthew J Tingstad appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls case.  Def failed to appear previously on 5/16 for summons.  Warrant was authorized but not presented for signature.  DA indicates will be issuing warrant.  Court questions how DA was provided new address.  DA received from updated driving record. Court authorizes warrant again, Wisconsin only.  Can post $500/appear Monday after arrest.  Adj.  9:17 a.m.  klr
Initial appearance on June 13, 2022 at 09:00 am.
